table.style: border: 1px #F0F0F0 solid; font-size: 11px; font-family: verdana; vertical-align: top;

tr.style: border: 2px #F0F0F0 solid; font-size: 11px; font-family: verdana; vertical-align: top

copyright.value: Users may only use AIMS if they respect the copyright and other intelectual property rights, which are held by Elsevier. AIMS was first described in: Piper, Martha C., et al. Construction and validation of the Alberta Infant Motor Scale (AIMS). Canadian journal of public health= Revue canadienne de sante publique 83 (1992): S46-50. Its currect use is described in: Piper, Martha, and Johanna Darrah. Motor Assessment of the Developing Infant-E-Book. Elsevier Health Sciences, 2021.
